alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 9:11AM MDT until April 24 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Tampico affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Tampico, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Tampico. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, flood over North Tampico Road north of the river begins to recede. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 23.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM MDT Sunday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 16.6 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.7 feet on 05/26/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon by 1200 PM MDT.
